part1.title: Quick Fit + Starting Package
part1.description: This part helps us decide whether we can work together now, and what the safest starting package is. Answer honestly — there is no "good" answer, only what is true today.
part1.instructions: Pick the option that is most true today. If unsure, pick the closest reality.

questions.text: Which best describes your situation right now?

options.text: We are new to this market or still early. We are trying to get more people to notice us and learn what kind of videos work.
We are already active in this market. We must be careful about brand rules, and we need a steady way to produce good videos.
We care about results. We have clear targets (sales, sign-ups, leads) and expect videos to help move those numbers.
We only sell locally and are not planning to expand to another market.

questions.text: Where do customers buy your product online?
questions.subtext: (You can share a link if available)

options.text: We sell online, but it's still early or small. We have an official selling link (website or marketplace like Shopee / TikTok Shop / Amazon), or it will be ready very soon.
Online sales are meaningful. We have website and some marketplace. We can track actions like link clicks, add-to-cart, or inquiries from our selling links.
Online sales are strong. We can reliably track completed purchases, subscriptions, or bookings from our selling links.
Customers mainly buy offline (supermarkets, distributors, retail stores). We don't have an official online selling link that we can track.

questions.text: After a social media post, what numbers can you actually see?

options.text: Mostly attention only: views, watch time, comments, shares/saves.
We can see actions: link clicks, add-to-cart, form fills, demo requests, inquiries.
We can see sales results: completed purchases/subscriptions/bookings (or qualified pipeline) and share them reliably.
We cannot access or share useful numbers right now.

questions.text: What would help you most in the next 4–8 weeks?

options.text: More people noticing us + fast learning on what messages and video styles work.
A safe, repeatable way to produce 'winning' creatives faster (without brand risk).
Measurable improvement in business results (leads/bookings/purchases) under clear rules.
Only a small set of finished videos (no testing, no review).

questions.text: Do you have a clear picture of your best customer (who you are really trying to win)?

options.text: We have a rough idea, but it changes and isn't written down.
We know who we want, but we must be very careful with tone/claims and approvals.
We can describe our best customer clearly, and we use numbers to judge whether we are reaching them.
We don't have a clear best customer; we sell to everyone.

questions.text: Where is your customer data today (orders/leads/inquiries)?

options.text: Mostly in comments/DMs; no clean list we can use.
We have platform/shop reports, but they're not consistent or easy to connect to content.
In a system like Shopify / TikTok Shop / Amazon / CRM, we can export/track/share regularly.
We can't access or share customer/order/lead data.

part2.title: Self‑Diagnosis
part2.description: This part is designed to help you spot where the system breaks today: getting attention, turning attention into actions, or turning actions into sales. Again: pick the option you could prove quickly.

questions.text: When a social post or campaign performs better than usual, what usually happens next?

options.text: We notice it did well, but we don't systematically build on it.
We try to apply the same idea again, but results are mixed.
We deliberately turn the learnings into a repeatable approach and test variations.
We usually move on and focus on new posts or campaigns.

questions.text: How do you usually decide what to post next?

options.text: We mostly go with gut feeling or what seems right at the moment.
We combine gut feeling with a quick look at past results.
We use clear signals and test results to decide what to publish next.
We don't really have a clear way of deciding.

questions.text: How much of your past learning is still usable today?

options.text: Very little — we often relearn the same lessons.
Some — we remember what worked, but it's not systemized.
A lot — we have clear references we actively reuse.
We don't really think in terms of learning over time.

questions.text: Where do experiments usually break down?

options.text: We don't test enough variations to learn quickly.
Brand rules or approvals slow down iteration.
Results fluctuate even when we follow the same approach.
The issue isn't content — it's something else.

questions.text: When results change week to week, what best explains it?

options.text: We don't know — performance feels random.
Platform or audience behavior changes unpredictably.
Small creative or offer differences create big swings.
External factors (stock, price, operations) dominate results.

questions.text: How confident are you when scaling something that works?

options.text: Not confident — we worry it won't work again.
Somewhat confident, but we scale cautiously.
Confident — we know why it works and how to extend it.
Scaling isn't our focus right now.

questions.text: What happens when performance drops unexpectedly?

options.text: We change many things quickly to recover.
We pause and try small adjustments.
We diagnose against past tests and adjust one variable.
We usually accept it and move on.

questions.text: Which statement best describes how your growth system feels today?

options.text: We get attention, but we are still figuring out what really works and how to repeat it.
We have a working process, but improving results feels slow and heavy.
We have clear numbers, but making results more stable and predictable is hard.
Our biggest problems are not related to marketing or content.

fields.label: Official online buy links (TikTok Shop / Shopee / Lazada / Shopify / Amazon / app store / booking page)
Markets you sell in (countries you are in)
Optional: what tracking data (platform purchase tracking, website analytics, order reports, CRM)
